column4: Hello, I just upgraded to 8.04 and when idle in system monitor my CPU usage is about 70%, thou no Processes are taking anything above 2%... Can anyone tell me what is happening?
in system monitor do View all processes and see what is using up the CPU
by default system monitor only shows you your processes, so you want to see all users processes
View -> All processes? there is xord at 7% and vinoserver at 12% thats all

yeah it is.. but strangely if I navigate away from the "resources" tab for a bit and then return I can see that when NOT having the resources tab open the CPU % drops to about 20%, but then returns to about 70% when I return to the "resources" tab
in my experience gnome-system-monitor takes a lot of CPU, to try something else install and try using htop in command line
if I quickly switch between resources and processes tab I can see that it is "Xorg" which is taking all the resources. But as I navigate away Xorg falls to sleep instantly
yes i get the same from Xorg occassionally, no idea what to do about it
Strange.. and I guess its only there when the resources tab is open :( Doesnt Xorg have something to do with the graptics? Could I be that I have a custom resolution or bad numbers in my custom res ?
Xorg is pretty much responsible for your desktop (X window sytem)
Ahh ok, just seems so strange.. I dont want to CPu working at 70% 24/7 when its a server and is never turned off
if its a pure server you don't need the gui, see ubuntu server
my computer is never turned off too, it does take a lot of cpu occassionally but not alwaus
I know I dont but Im a total linux noob go I have the gui for configuring things hehe
fair enough but the server OS was made with no gui for a very good security reason
and the best way to learn is to use the command line, as using the gui is never the solution
Its only for personal NAS storage and private ftp.. all other ports are locked anyway so I dont think anyone would hack it anyway
